title: Software Is Changing (Again): Introduction of Software 3.0 and Vibe Coding
description: Andrej Karpathy delivered a keynote at Y Combinator AI Startup School introducing 'Software 3.0' - the evolution from traditional code (1.0) to neural networks (2.0) to AI-native prompt-based development (3.0). He coined 'vibe coding' to describe programming through natural language with AI tools, emphasizing creative flow states and democratizing software development.
author: Andrej Karpathy

title: Agentic AI Coding Best Practices and Team Integration
description: Simon Willison shared comprehensive insights on using AI coding tools effectively in teams, including prompt patterns for agentic coding, the discovery of reinforcement learning from verifiable rewards (RLVR), and practical recommendations for AI-assisted development workflows. He emphasized the importance of treating AI tools as collaborators rather than replacements.
author: Simon Willison

title: Apple Foundation Models Framework and Containerization Innovations
description: Simon Willison analyzed Apple's new Foundation Models framework and its containerization approach for AI model deployment. He explored how Apple's strategy differs from other tech giants and what it means for developers working with AI models on Apple platforms.
author: Simon Willison

title: Replit Achieves $100M ARR and Launches AI Agent Partnerships
description: Amjad Masad announced Replit crossed $100M ARR (up from $10M at end of 2024) and secured partnerships including with HUMAIN. He positioned Replit's Agent 4 as enabling anyone to build software 'like a Google engineer', while warning about AI tools' disruption of traditional coding jobs.
author: Amjad Masad

title: The Future of Software Creation: Making Programming Accessible to All
description: Amjad Masad delivered a keynote at Y Combinator AI Startup School discussing how AI tools are making programming accessible to everyone. He shared his vision that AI-powered development tools are democratizing software creation faster than anticipated.
author: Amjad Masad

title: AI and the Future of Mathematics: Terence Tao on Lean, Formal Proofs, and Mathematical AI
description: Terence Tao discussed the transformative potential of AI in mathematics, focusing on the Lean programming language for formal proof verification, the challenges of scaling AI to solve research-level problems, and the potential for AI-assisted mathematical discovery. He emphasized the importance of developing mathematical 'sense of smell' in AI systems.
author: Terence Tao
